body.p:
Office of the New York County and Debtors Jail
Aug. 31. 1865.
To his Excellency
Thos E. Bramelette
Governor. State of Kentucky
Sir.

I am a Notary and Commissioner for the state of New York and almost daily have applications to take depositions for your state. If agreeable to your rules I should be pleased to receive the appointment of Commissioner for Kentucky, and would state that there is no Commissioner resident in this immediate neighborhood, and parties (debtors) confined herein have great difficulty in procurring the services of a Commissioner, so that such an appointment would be a service as well as a saving to them of time and expense

Trusting that your Excellency will view the
application favorably

I have the honor to remain Your Most Obt srvant
Wm. L. Gardner
Clerk NYork County Jail

Refer to
Hon John Kelby
Sheriff
Hon Adaky Hall
Dist Attorney
Hon Wm M Tweed
Prest Board of Supervisors
Hon Danl T. Dickens
U.S. Dist Attorney
Hon Robt Murray
U.S. Marshall
Hon Elijah F. Purdy
Supervisor

Comr of Deeds
New York
Wm L Gardner
comd
4 Sept 1865
